title: Bug: process.exit and app.exit Overflow On Windows
body:
Current versions of atom/apm fail to exit cleanly on Windows when process.exit or app.exit are used (e.g. https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/75f286cc55978810d7ec6efe5efe4090b78586ae/src/initialize-test-window.coffee#L13)

``` coffeescript
exitWithStatusCode = (status) ->
  console.log('Exiting With Status Code:' + status)
  remote.require('app').emit('will-quit')
  process.exit(status)
```

```
C:\Users\vagrant\github\go-runtime>atom --dev --test c:\Users\vagrant\github\go-
runtime\spec

Window load time: 711ms
...................................

Finished in 1.479 seconds
35 tests, 225 assertions, 0 failures, 0 skipped

Exiting With Status Code:0

C:\Users\vagrant\github\go-runtime>echo %errorlevel%
-1073740940
```

Using app.exit exhibits the same behavior:

``` coffeescript
exitWithStatusCode = (status) ->
  console.log('Exiting With Status Code:' + status)
  app = remote.require('app')
  app.emit('will-quit')
  app.exit(status)
```

app.quit() results in an exit code of 0 **always** for obvious reasons, as it does not accept an exit code. But it does not overflow!

```
exitWithStatusCode = (status) ->
  console.log('Exiting With Status Code:' + status)
  app = remote.require('app')
  app.emit('will-quit')
  app.quit()
```

```
C:\Users\vagrant\github\go-runtime>atom --dev --test c:\Users\vagrant\github\go-
runtime\spec

Window load time: 2270ms
.......F...........................

Locator
  when the environment is process.env
    it findExecutablesInPath returns an empty array if its arguments are invalid

      Expected false to be true. (spec\locator-spec.js:83:21)


Finished in 1.397 seconds
35 tests, 226 assertions, 1 failure, 0 skipped

Exiting With Status Code:1

C:\Users\vagrant\github\go-runtime>echo %errorlevel%
0
```

/cc @nathansobo @zcbenz @50Wliu @thomasjo
